availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Attended Emory & Henry College from 1857 to 1858. Served as Clerk in Floyd County, Kentucky in 1860. Moved to Texas with parents prior to war. Returned to Kentucky. Served as a first lieutenant in the 38th Enrolled Militia of Floyd County. Served as first lieutenant in the Fifth Kentucky Infantry Regiment (Co. E) in the Confederate States Army from January 1862 to October 1862. Served as a captain, lieutenant colonel, and colonel in the Tenth Kentucky Cavalry (Co. A). Died at the Battle of Saltsville on October 2, 1864.

bibl.p: KYR-0002-022-0002; Bruce S. Allardice and Lawrence Lee Hewitt, eds., Kentuckians in Gray: Confederate Generals and Field Officers of the Bluegrass State (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2008), 311; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 2.
